Activity: Log in to the system, check emails. Review the previous day's work and address any immediate action items.
Refine the report template outline based on yesterday's research and brainstorming. Finalize the section structure and content placeholders.

Focus on predictive modeling. Research different predictive models suitable for influenza forecasting (e.g., ARIMA, time series regression, machine learning models). @HIS-1, @HIS-2, send them an email to ask for the suggestions about the most recent predictive model used in the field. Topic: Influenza Trend Predictive Modeling Techniques

Draft the 'Predictive Modeling Results' section of the report template. Outline how the model's performance will be evaluated (e.g., accuracy, precision, recall), and how the results will be visualized and interpreted.

Develop a detailed design specification for each data visualization included in the template. Specify the data variables to be used, the chart type, the axis labels, the color scheme, and any interactive elements.

Begin drafting the 'Key Findings' section of the report template. Outline the key trends and patterns in influenza activity that will be highlighted, based on historical data and preliminary analysis.

Contact @CLINLEAD-1 and @PCHMP-1 via email to schedule a brief meeting to discuss the specific information needs of clinical staff and hospital administration regarding influenza trends. Topic: Information Needs for Influenza Trend Report.
Review the report template so far and prepare for the meeting tomorrow. Prepare some possible questions from the Clinical Lead.
